judgment.text: The Creative works sublime success, furthering through perseverance.
judgment.explanation: The Creative is the beginning of all things, representing pure spirit manifesting as pure yang energy. Success comes through maintaining this creative force with persistence.

image.text: The movement of heaven is full of power.
image.explanation: The wise person models themselves after heaven's example, becoming strong and tireless in their good works.

lines.meaning: Hidden dragon. Do not act.
lines.explanation: Initial creative power remains hidden, waiting for the right time.

lines.meaning: Dragon appearing in the field. It furthers one to see the great person.
lines.explanation: The influence becomes visible in the outer world. The time has come to meet with the great person.

lines.meaning: All day long the superior person is creatively active. At nightfall his mind is still beset with cares. Danger. No blame.
lines.explanation: A position of influence brings both opportunity and responsibility.

lines.meaning: Wavering flight over the depths. No blame.
lines.explanation: Uncertain whether to advance or retreat. Either choice is acceptable.

lines.meaning: Flying dragon in the heavens. It furthers one to see the great person.
lines.explanation: The great person is in a position to realize their full potential.

lines.meaning: Arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.
lines.explanation: Going too far leads to a fall. Pride comes before a fall.

judgment.text: The Receptive brings about sublime success, furthering through the perseverance of a mare.
judgment.explanation: The Receptive represents the perfect complement to the Creative—the yin to its yang. Through devoted acceptance and nurturing, all things come to fruition.

image.text: The earth's condition is receptive devotion.
image.explanation: The wise person who has breadth of character carries and supports all things, just as the earth supports all life.

lines.meaning: When hoarfrost comes, solid ice is not far behind.
lines.explanation: Natural progression from subtle to manifest yin energy.

lines.meaning: Straight, square, great. Without purpose, yet nothing remains unfurthered.
Hidden lines. One is able to remain persevering. If by chance you are in the service of a king, seek not works, but bring to completion.
A tied-up sack. No blame, no praise.
A yellow lower garment brings supreme good fortune.
Dragons fight in the meadow. Their blood is black and yellow.

judgment.text: Difficulty at the Beginning works supreme success, furthering through perseverance. Nothing should be undertaken. It furthers one to appoint helpers.
judgment.explanation: Like a seed sprouting through soil, all beginnings face resistance. Success comes through patience and seeking appropriate assistance.

image.text: Clouds and thunder: The image of Difficulty at the Beginning.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man brings order out of confusion by carefully organizing each step of the process.

lines.meaning: Hesitation and hindrance. It furthers one to remain persevering.
lines.explanation: At the start of difficulty, careful consideration and steady persistence are needed.

lines.meaning: Difficulties pile up. Horse and wagon part. He is not a robber; he wants to woo when the time comes. The maiden is chaste, she does not pledge herself. Ten years—then she pledges herself.
Whoever hunts deer without the forester only loses his way in the forest. The superior man understands the signs of the time and prefers to desist. To go on brings humiliation.
Horse and wagon part. Strive for union. To go brings good fortune. Everything acts to further.
Difficulties in blessing. Small perseverance brings good fortune. Great perseverance brings misfortune.
Horse and wagon part. Bloody tears flow.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Youthful Folly has success. It is not I who seek the young fool; The young fool seeks me.
judgment.explanation: In the state of inexperience, success comes through recognizing one's limitations and actively seeking guidance. The teacher does not chase the student; the student must seek the teacher.

image.text: A spring wells up at the foot of the mountain: The image of Youth.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man fosters his character by thoroughness in all that he does, learning from each experience with dedication.

lines.meaning: To make a fool develop it furthers one to apply discipline.
lines.explanation: Development requires structure and boundaries. Discipline creates the foundation for learning.

lines.meaning: To show forbearance toward the ignorant furthers. To take a girl to wife brings good fortune.
Take not a maiden who, when she sees a man of bronze, loses possession of herself. Nothing furthers.
Entangled folly brings humiliation.
Childlike folly brings good fortune.
In punishing folly it does not further one to commit transgressions. The only thing that furthers is to prevent transgressions.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Waiting. If you are sincere, you have light and success. Perseverance brings good fortune.
judgment.explanation: Like clouds gathering before rain, there are times when waiting is the most appropriate action. Success comes through maintaining inner truth during periods of anticipation.

image.text: Clouds rise up to heaven: The image of Waiting.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man eats and drinks, finding joy and peace in the natural timing of things.

lines.meaning: Waiting in the meadow. It furthers one to abide in what endures.
lines.explanation: In the beginning of waiting, stay grounded in what is stable and lasting.

lines.meaning: Waiting on the sand. There is some gossip. The end brings good fortune.
Waiting in the mud brings about the arrival of the enemy.
Waiting in blood. Get out of the pit.
Waiting at meat and drink. Perseverance brings good fortune.
One falls into the pit. Three uninvited guests arrive. Honor them, and in the end there will be good fortune.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Conflict. You are sincere and are being obstructed. A cautious halt halfway brings good fortune. Going through to the end brings misfortune.
judgment.explanation: When conflict arises, the wise person knows when to advance and when to retreat. Victory at any cost often leads to greater losses, while thoughtful moderation can resolve disputes.

image.text: Heaven and water go their opposite ways: The image of Conflict.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man carefully considers the beginning of every action, knowing that proper planning can prevent unnecessary strife.

lines.meaning: If one does not perpetuate the affair, there is a little gossip. In the end, good fortune comes.
lines.explanation: Avoiding the escalation of minor disputes leads to positive outcomes. Let small conflicts naturally dissolve.

lines.meaning: One cannot engage in conflict; one returns home, gives way. The people of his town, three hundred households, remain free of guilt.
To nourish oneself on ancient virtue induces perseverance. Danger. In the end, good fortune comes. If by chance you are in the service of a king, seek not works.
One cannot engage in conflict. One turns back and submits to fate, changes one's attitude, and finds peace in perseverance. Good fortune.
To contend before him brings supreme good fortune.
Even if by chance a leather belt is bestowed on one, by the end of a morning it will have been snatched away three times.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: The Army needs perseverance and a strong man. Good fortune without blame.
judgment.explanation: Success comes through proper organization and righteous leadership. Discipline must be maintained, but it should serve a just cause.

image.text: In the middle of the earth is water: The image of the Army.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man increases his masses by generosity toward the people, nurturing their loyalty through genuine care and support.

lines.meaning: An army must set forth in proper order. If the order is not good, misfortune threatens.
lines.explanation: The foundation of any collective endeavor lies in proper organization. Without clear structure, even the strongest force will falter.

lines.meaning: In the midst of the army. Good fortune. No blame. The king bestows a triple decoration.
Perchance the army carries corpses in the wagon. Misfortune.
The army retreats. No blame.
There is game in the field. It furthers one to catch it. Without blame. Let the eldest lead the army. The younger transports corpses; then perseverance brings misfortune.
The great prince issues commands, founds states, vests families with fiefs. Inferior people should not be employed.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Holding Together brings good fortune. Inquire of the oracle once again whether you possess sublimity, constancy, and perseverance.
judgment.explanation: True unity requires ongoing commitment and self-examination. Success comes through genuine connection and mutual support, not superficial alliances.

image.text: On the earth is water: The image of Holding Together.
image.explanation: Thus the kings of antiquity bestowed the different states as fiefs and cultivated friendly relations with the feudal lords, recognizing that lasting unity comes through respect for natural bonds.

lines.meaning: Hold to him in truth and loyalty; this is without blame.
lines.explanation: Authentic connections formed at the beginning establish a foundation for lasting unity. Sincerity attracts genuine support.

lines.meaning: Hold to him inwardly. Perseverance brings good fortune.
You hold together with the wrong people.
Hold to him outwardly also. Perseverance brings good fortune.
Manifestation of holding together. In the hunt the king uses beaters on three sides only and foregoes game that runs off in front. The citizens need no warning. Good fortune.
He finds no head for holding together. Misfortune.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

name: Hsiao Ch'u
description: The Taming Power of the Small

judgment.text: The Taming Power of the Small has success. Dense clouds, no rain from our western region.
judgment.explanation: Small influences can accumulate to create significant effects. Success comes through gentle but persistent action rather than forceful measures.

image.text: The wind drives across heaven: The image of The Taming Power of the Small.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man refines the outward aspect of his nature through steady, incremental improvements.

lines.meaning: Return to the way. How could there be blame in this? Good fortune.
lines.explanation: Recognizing and correcting one's course early leads to favorable outcomes.

lines.meaning: He allows himself to be drawn into returning. Good fortune.
The spokes burst out of the wagon wheels. Man and wife roll their eyes.
If you are sincere, blood vanishes and fear gives way. No blame.
If you are sincere and loyally attached, you are rich in your neighbor.
The rain comes, there is rest. This is due to the lasting effect of character. Perseverance brings the woman into danger. The moon is nearly full. If the superior man persists, misfortune comes.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Treading upon the tail of the tiger. It does not bite the man. Success.
judgment.explanation: Progress comes through careful and respectful conduct, even in dangerous situations. Maintaining proper behavior while facing challenges leads to success.

image.text: Heaven above, the lake below: The image of Treading.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man discriminates between high and low, and thereby fortifies the thinking of the people through clear principles and proper conduct.

lines.meaning: Simple conduct. Progress without blame.
lines.explanation: Straightforward and honest behavior creates a path forward without complications.

lines.meaning: Treading a smooth, level course. The perseverance of a dark man brings good fortune.
A one-eyed man is able to see, a lame man is able to tread. He treads on the tail of the tiger. The tiger bites the man. Misfortune. Thus does a warrior act on behalf of his great prince.
He treads on the tail of the tiger. Caution and circumspection lead ultimately to good fortune.
Resolute conduct. Perseverance with awareness of danger.
Look to your conduct and weigh the favorable signs. When everything is fulfilled, supreme good fortune comes.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Peace. The small departs, the great approaches. Good fortune. Success.
judgment.explanation: A time of natural harmony when heaven and earth connect. Small matters fade as greater opportunities emerge, creating conditions for growth and prosperity.

image.text: Heaven and earth unite: the image of Peace.
image.explanation: Thus the ruler divides and completes the course of heaven and earth, furthering and regulating the gifts of heaven and earth to aid the people.

lines.meaning: When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it. Each according to his kind. Undertakings bring good fortune.
lines.explanation: Natural connections lead to mutual growth and benefit. Like plants growing together, aligned efforts bring success.

lines.meaning: Bearing with the uncultured in gentleness, fording the river with resolution, not neglecting what is distant, not regarding one's companions: Thus one may manage to walk in the middle.
No plain not followed by a slope. No going not followed by a return. He who remains persevering in danger is without blame. Do not complain about this truth; Enjoy the good fortune you still possess.
He flutters down, not boasting of his wealth, together with his neighbor, guileless and sincere.
The sovereign I gives his daughter in marriage. This brings blessing and supreme good fortune.
The wall falls back into the moat. Use no army now. Make your commands known within your own town. Perseverance brings humiliation.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Standstill. Evil people do not further the perseverance of the superior man. The great departs; the small approaches.
judgment.explanation: A time when communication between higher and lower is blocked. Progress is difficult, and inferior influences gain temporary power. Patience and integrity are essential.

image.text: Heaven and earth do not unite: The image of Standstill.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man falls back upon their inner worth to escape difficulties. They do not permit themselves to be honored with revenue during times of stagnation.

lines.meaning: When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it. Each according to his kind. Perseverance brings good fortune and success.
lines.explanation: Even in times of stagnation, maintaining connections with like-minded people brings stability and eventual progress.

lines.meaning: They bear and endure; This means good fortune for inferior people. The standstill serves to help the great man to attain success.
They bear shame.
He who acts at the command of the highest remains without blame. Those of like mind partake of the blessing.
Standstill is giving way. Good fortune for the great man. 'What if it should fail, what if it should fail?' In this way he ties it to a cluster of mulberry shoots.
The standstill comes to an end. First standstill, then good fortune.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Fellowship with Men in the open. Success. It furthers one to cross the great water.
judgment.explanation: True fellowship arises when individuals unite through shared principles and aspirations. Open and honest relationships create the foundation for great achievements.

image.text: Heaven together with fire: The image of Fellowship with Men.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man organizes the clans and makes distinctions between things, creating harmony through proper relationships and clear boundaries.

lines.meaning: Fellowship with men at the gate. No blame.
lines.explanation: Initial connections formed openly and naturally bring no regret. The beginning of fellowship should be straightforward and uncontrived.

lines.meaning: Fellowship with men in the clan. Humiliation.
He hides weapons in the thicket; He climbs the high hill in front of it. For three years he does not rise up.
He climbs up on his wall; he cannot attack. Good fortune.
Men bound in fellowship first weep and lament, but afterward they laugh. After great struggles they succeed in meeting.
Fellowship with men in the meadow. No remorse.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Modesty creates success. The superior man carries things through.
judgment.explanation: True modesty is a strength, not a weakness. Like a mountain beneath the earth, those who remain humble while capable achieve lasting success.

image.text: Within the earth, a mountain: The image of Modesty.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man reduces that which is too much, and augments that which is too little. They weigh things and make them equal, creating balance through modest adjustment.

lines.meaning: A superior man modest about his modesty may cross the great water. Good fortune.
lines.explanation: Genuine humility, even about one's own modesty, enables one to undertake challenging tasks successfully.

lines.meaning: Modesty that comes to expression. Perseverance brings good fortune.
A superior man of modesty and merit carries things to conclusion. Good fortune.
Nothing that would not further modesty in movement.
No boasting of wealth before one's neighbor. It furthers one to attack with force. Nothing that would not further.
Modesty that comes to expression. It furthers one to set armies marching to chastise one's own city and one's country.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Approach has supreme success. Perseverance furthers. When the eighth month comes, there will be misfortune.
judgment.explanation: A time of growing influence and responsibility. Success comes through consistent, thoughtful leadership, but be mindful of cycles of change.

image.text: The earth above the lake: The image of Approach.
image.explanation: Thus the superior man is inexhaustible in his will to teach, and without limits in his tolerance and protection of the people.

lines.meaning: Joint approach. Perseverance brings good fortune.
lines.explanation: Working together with others at the beginning of an endeavor brings success through shared purpose.

lines.meaning: Joint approach. Good fortune. Everything furthers.
Comfortable approach. Nothing that would not further. If one is induced to grieve over it, one becomes free of blame.
Complete approach. No blame.
Wise approach. This is right for a great prince. Good fortune.
Generous approach. Good fortune. No blame.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Contemplation. The ablution has been made, but not yet the offering. Full of trust they look up to him.
judgment.explanation: A time for careful observation and reflection before action. Understanding comes through patient attention and respectful consideration.

image.text: The wind blows over the earth: The image of Contemplation.
image.explanation: Thus the kings of old visited the regions of the world, contemplated the people, and gave them instruction based on careful observation.

lines.meaning: Boyish contemplation. For an inferior man, no blame. For a superior man, humiliation.
lines.explanation: Superficial observation leads to shallow understanding. Mature wisdom requires deeper insight.

lines.meaning: Contemplation through the crack of the door. Furthering for the perseverance of a woman.
Contemplation of my life decides the choice between advance and retreat.
Contemplation of the light of the kingdom. It furthers one to exert influence as the guest of a king.
Contemplation of my life. The superior man is without blame.
Contemplation of his life. The superior man is without blame.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Biting Through has success. It is favorable to let justice be administered.
judgment.explanation: Like a bite breaking through an obstacle, decisive action is needed to resolve difficulties. Justice requires both firmness and clarity.

image.text: Thunder and lightning: The image of Biting Through.
image.explanation: Thus the kings of former times made firm the laws through clearly defined penalties, establishing order through clear consequences.

lines.meaning: His feet are fastened in the stocks, so that his toes disappear. No blame.
lines.explanation: Initial restraint in dealing with obstacles prevents hasty actions that might bring regret.

lines.meaning: Bites through tender meat, so that his nose disappears. No blame.
Bites on old dried meat and strikes on something poisonous. Slight humiliation. No blame.
Bites on dried gristly meat. Receives metal arrows. It furthers one to be mindful of difficulties and to be persevering. Good fortune.
Bites on dried lean meat. Receives yellow gold. Perseveringly aware of danger. No blame.
His neck is fastened in the wooden cangue, so that his ears disappear. Misfortune.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Grace has success. In small matters it is favorable to undertake something.
judgment.explanation: Aesthetic refinement brings success when applied with restraint. Focus on genuine inner development rather than superficial appearances.

image.text: Fire at the foot of the mountain: The image of Grace.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person clarifies matters of government through elegance and grace, but dares not to decide controversial issues in this way.

lines.meaning: He lends grace to his toes, leaves the carriage, and walks.
lines.explanation: Choosing a simpler path with dignity rather than maintaining pretense. True grace comes from authentic action.

lines.meaning: Lends grace to the beard on his chin.
Graceful and moist. Constant perseverance brings good fortune.
Grace or simplicity? A white horse comes as if on wings. He is not a robber, he will woo at the right time.
Grace in hills and gardens. The roll of silk is meager and small. Humiliation, but in the end good fortune.
Simple grace. No blame.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Splitting Apart. It does not further one to go anywhere.
judgment.explanation: A time when structures are breaking down. Rather than forcing progress, accept the process of dissolution as preparation for future renewal.

image.text: The mountain rests on the earth: The image of Splitting Apart.
image.explanation: Thus those above can ensure their position only by giving generously to those below, maintaining connection even in times of separation.

lines.meaning: The leg of the bed is split. Those who persevere are destroyed. Misfortune.
lines.explanation: When foundations begin to crack, continuing as before brings disaster. Recognition of decline is necessary.

lines.meaning: The bed is split at the edge. Those who persevere are destroyed. Misfortune.
He splits with them. No blame.
The bed is split up to the skin. Misfortune.
A shoal of fishes. Favor comes through the court ladies. Everything acts to further.
The source of enthusiasm. He achieves great things. Doubt not. You gather friends around you as a hair clasp gathers the hair.
Noble-hearted return. No remorse.

Missing the return. Misfortune. Misfortune from within and without. If armies are set marching in this way, one will in the end suffer a great defeat, disastrous for the ruler of the country. For ten years it will not be possible to attack again.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Return. Success. Going out and coming in without error. Friends come without blame. To and fro goes the way.
judgment.explanation: After darkness comes light. Natural cycles bring renewal, and what was lost returns of its own accord when the time is right.

image.text: Thunder within the earth: The image of the Turning Point.
image.explanation: Thus the kings of antiquity closed the passes at the time of solstice, halting trade and travelers, honoring the natural time of stillness.

lines.meaning: Return from a short distance. No need for remorse. Great good fortune.
lines.explanation: Recognizing and correcting minor deviations quickly leads to the best outcome. Early awareness prevents larger problems.

lines.meaning: Turning to the summit for nourishment, deviating from the path to seek nourishment from the hill. Continuing to do this brings misfortune.
Turning away from nourishment. Perseverance brings misfortune. Do not act thus for ten years. Nothing serves to further.
Turning to the summit for provision of nourishment brings good fortune. Spying about with sharp eyes like a tiger with insatiable craving. No blame.
Turning away from the path. To remain persevering brings good fortune. One should not cross the great water.
The source of nourishment. Awareness of danger brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Innocence. Supreme success. Perseverance furthers. If someone is not as he should be, he has misfortune, and it does not further him to undertake anything.
judgment.explanation: Success comes through natural authenticity and alignment with truth. Artificial behavior or hidden agendas bring misfortune.

image.text: Under heaven thunder rolls: All things attain the natural state of Innocence.
image.explanation: Thus the kings of old, rich in virtue and in harmony with the time, fostered and nourished all beings, allowing each to develop according to its nature.

lines.meaning: Innocent behavior brings good fortune.
lines.explanation: Acting with natural simplicity and truthfulness leads to positive outcomes. No need for complexity or artifice.

lines.meaning: If one does not count on the harvest while plowing, nor on the use of the ground while clearing it, it furthers one to undertake something.
Undeserved misfortune. The cow that was tethered by someone is the wanderer's gain, the citizen's loss.
He who can be persevering remains without blame.
Use no medicine in an illness incurred through no fault of your own. It will pass of itself.
Innocent action brings misfortune. Nothing furthers.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

name: Ta Ch'u
description: The Taming Power of the Great

judgment.text: The Taming Power of the Great. Perseverance furthers. Not eating at home brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.
judgment.explanation: Great power must be contained and directed wisely. Success comes through disciplined restraint and appropriate timing of significant actions.

image.text: Heaven within the mountain: The image of The Taming Power of the Great.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person acquaints themselves with many sayings of antiquity and many deeds of the past, to strengthen their character thereby.

lines.meaning: Danger is at hand. It furthers one to desist.
lines.explanation: When facing potential danger, knowing when to stop is crucial. Restraint prevents unnecessary risks.

lines.meaning: The axle straps of the big wagon.
A good horse that follows others. Awareness of danger, with perseverance, furthers. Practice chariot driving and armed defense daily. It furthers one to have somewhere to go.
The headboard of a young bull. Great good fortune.
The tusk of a gelded boar. Good fortune.
One attains the way of heaven. Success.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Nourishment. Perseverance brings good fortune. Pay heed to the providing of nourishment and to what a man seeks to fill his own mouth with.
judgment.explanation: Success comes through careful attention to what truly nourishes body and spirit. Consider both how one provides for others and what one takes in.

image.text: At the foot of the mountain, thunder: The image of Providing Nourishment.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person is careful of their words and temperate in eating and drinking, maintaining balance in all forms of nourishment.

lines.meaning: You let your magic tortoise go, and look at me with the corners of your mouth drooping. Misfortune.
lines.explanation: Neglecting one's spiritual sustenance for material concerns leads to loss. True nourishment begins with proper priorities.

lines.meaning: Turning to the summit for nourishment, deviating from the path to seek nourishment from the hill. Continuing to do this brings misfortune.
Turning away from nourishment. Perseverance brings misfortune. Do not act thus for ten years. Nothing serves to further.
Turning to the summit for provision of nourishment brings good fortune. Spying about with sharp eyes like a tiger with insatiable craving. No blame.
Turning away from the path. To remain persevering brings good fortune. One should not cross the great water.
The source of nourishment. Awareness of danger brings good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

name: Hsien
judgment: Influence. Success. Perseverance furthers. To take a maiden to wife brings good fortune.
image: A lake on the mountain: The image of Influence. Thus the superior man encourages people to approach him by his readiness to receive them.

lines.meaning: The influence shows itself in the big toe.
The influence shows itself in the calves of the legs. Misfortune. Tarrying brings good fortune.
The influence shows itself in the thighs. Holds to that which follows it. To continue is humiliating.
Perseverance brings good fortune. Remorse disappears. If a man is agitated in mind, and his thoughts go hither and thither, only those friends on whom he fixes his conscious thoughts will follow.
The influence shows itself in the back of the neck. No remorse.
The influence shows itself in the jaws, cheeks, and tongue.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

name: Heng
judgment: Duration. Success. No blame. Perseverance furthers. It furthers one to have somewhere to go.
image: Thunder and wind: the image of Duration. Thus the superior man stands firm and does not change his direction.

lines.meaning: Seeking duration too hastily brings misfortune persistently. Nothing that would further.
Remorse disappears.
He who does not give duration to his character meets with disgrace. Persistent humiliation.
No game in the field.
Giving duration to one's character through perseverance. This is good fortune for a woman, misfortune for a man.
Restlessness as an enduring condition brings misfortune.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

name: Tun
judgment: Retreat. Success. In what is small, perseverance furthers.
image: Mountain under heaven: the image of Retreat. Thus the superior man keeps the inferior man at a distance, not angrily but with reserve.

lines.meaning: At the tail in retreat. This is dangerous. One should not wish to undertake anything.
He holds him fast with yellow oxhide. No one can tear him loose.
A halted retreat is nerve-wracking and dangerous. To retain people as men- and maidservants brings good fortune.
Voluntary retreat brings good fortune to the superior man and downfall to the inferior man.
Friendly retreat. Perseverance brings good fortune.
Cheerful retreat. Everything serves to further.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: The Power of the Great. Perseverance furthers.
judgment.explanation: Great power requires great responsibility. Success comes through maintaining ethical strength and knowing when to hold back.

image.text: Thunder in heaven above: The image of the Power of the Great.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person does not tread upon paths that do not accord with established order, showing restraint even at the height of power.

lines.meaning: Power in the toes. Continuing brings misfortune. This is certainly true.
lines.explanation: Using force in minor matters leads to problems. Great power must be applied wisely and at the right level.

judgment.text: Progress. The powerful prince is honored with horses in large numbers. In a single day he is granted audience three times.
judgment.explanation: A time of recognition and advancement. Success comes through maintaining humility while receiving honors.

image.text: The sun rises over the earth: The image of Progress.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person themselves brightens their bright virtue, allowing their light to gradually influence others.

lines.meaning: Progressing, but turned back. Perseverance brings good fortune. If one meets with no confidence, one should remain calm. No mistake.
lines.explanation: Initial setbacks in advancement should not discourage. Maintain integrity and patience during delays.

judgment.text: Darkening of the Light. In adversity it furthers one to be persevering.
judgment.explanation: When light is obscured, preserve inner brightness. Success comes through maintaining integrity even when it cannot be openly displayed.

image.text: The light has sunk into the earth: The image of Darkening of the Light.
image.explanation: Thus does the superior person live with the great mass: They veil their light, yet still shine, adapting to difficult circumstances without losing their essence.

lines.meaning: Darkening of the light during flight. They lower their wings. The superior person does not eat for three days on their wanderings. But they have somewhere to go. The host has occasion to gossip about them.
lines.explanation: In times of darkness, maintain dignity while retreating. Though others may misunderstand, stay true to your principles.

judgment.text: The Family. The perseverance of the woman furthers.
judgment.explanation: Success in the family requires gentle but firm guidance. Like wind over fire, influence through warmth and consistent direction.

image.text: Wind comes forth from fire: The image of the Family.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person has substance in their words and duration in their way of life, establishing order through consistent example.

lines.meaning: Firm seclusion within the family. Remorse disappears.
lines.explanation: Clear boundaries create harmony. Establishing proper rules and roles from the start prevents later difficulties.

judgment.text: Opposition. In small matters, good fortune.
judgment.explanation: When fundamental differences exist, focus on areas of agreement. Like fire and water, opposing forces can still work in harmony within proper bounds.

image.text: Above, fire; below, the lake: The image of Opposition.
image.explanation: Thus amid all fellowship the superior person retains their individuality, finding unity in diversity.

lines.meaning: Remorse disappears. If you lose your horse, do not run after it; it will come back of its own accord.
lines.explanation: Trust allows resolution of differences. Don't force harmony; let natural alignment occur in its own time.

judgment.text: Obstruction. The southwest furthers. The northeast does not further. It furthers one to see the great man. Perseverance brings good fortune.
judgment.explanation: When progress is blocked, seek guidance and adjust direction. Like water finding its way around a mountain, success comes through flexible adaptation.

image.text: Water on the mountain: The image of Obstruction.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person turns their attention to themselves and molds their character, finding opportunity for growth in difficulty.

lines.meaning: Going leads to obstructions, coming meets with praise.
lines.explanation: Sometimes retreat is the best advance. Recognition of obstacles allows for better strategic choices.

judgment.text: Deliverance. The southwest furthers. If there is no longer anything where one has to go, return brings good fortune. If there is still something where one has to go, hastening brings good fortune.
judgment.explanation: A time of release from tension. Like thunder and rain clearing the air, progress comes through knowing when to advance and when to return.

image.text: Thunder and rain set in: The image of Deliverance.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person pardons mistakes and forgives misdeeds, recognizing that release of old grievances brings renewal.

lines.meaning: Without blame.
lines.explanation: Freedom from entanglement allows clear progress. A clean start brings no regrets.

judgment.text: Decrease combined with sincerity brings about supreme good fortune without blame. One may be persevering in this.
judgment.explanation: Sometimes less is more. Success comes through willing reduction and sincere simplification, like a mountain reflecting in a lake's surface.

image.text: At the foot of the mountain, the lake: The image of Decrease.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person controls their anger and restrains their instincts, finding strength through conscious limitation.

lines.meaning: Going quickly when one's tasks are finished is without blame. But one should reflect on how much one may decrease others.
lines.explanation: Consider the impact of your actions on others. Swift completion should not come at others' expense.

judgment.text: Increase. It furthers one to undertake something. It furthers one to cross the great water.
judgment.explanation: A time of growth and expansion. Like wind spreading thunder's influence, progress comes through sharing benefits and extending one's reach.

image.text: Wind and thunder: The image of Increase.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person, when they see good, imitates it; when they see fault, they transform it, learning and growing through all experiences.

lines.meaning: It furthers one to accomplish great deeds. Supreme good fortune. No blame.
lines.explanation: A time for significant achievement. When increase aligns with greater purpose, major accomplishments are possible.

judgment.text: Break-through. One must resolutely make the matter known at the court of the king. It must be announced truthfully. Danger. It is necessary to notify one's own city. It does not further to resort to arms. It furthers one to undertake something.
judgment.explanation: A time requiring clear communication and decisive action. Like water breaking through barriers, progress comes through firm but measured steps.

image.text: The lake has risen up to heaven: The image of Break-through.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person dispenses riches downward and refrains from resting on their virtue, sharing benefits while maintaining humility.

lines.meaning: Mighty in the forward-striding toes. When one goes and is not equal to the task, one makes a mistake.
lines.explanation: Overconfident advancement leads to setbacks. Ensure capacity matches ambition before moving forward.

judgment.text: Coming to Meet. The maiden is powerful. One should not marry such a maiden.
judgment.explanation: Unexpected encounters require careful handling. Like wind meeting heaven, maintain appropriate boundaries in new situations.

image.text: Under heaven, wind: The image of Coming to Meet.
image.explanation: Thus does the prince act when disseminating commands and proclaiming them to the four quarters of heaven, ensuring clear communication in all directions.

lines.meaning: It must be checked with a brake of bronze. Perseverance brings good fortune. If one lets it take its course, one experiences misfortune. Even a lean pig has it in him to rage around.
lines.explanation: Initial restraint prevents later problems. Like checking momentum early, proper control maintains beneficial outcomes.

judgment.text: Gathering Together. Success. The king approaches his temple. It furthers one to see the great man. This brings success. Perseverance furthers. To bring great offerings creates good fortune. It furthers one to undertake something.
judgment.explanation: Unity brings accomplishment. Like water gathering in a lake, coming together with proper respect and purpose creates lasting benefit.

image.text: Over the earth, the lake: The image of Gathering Together.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person renews their weapons in order to meet the unforeseen, preparing while maintaining harmony.

lines.meaning: If you are sincere, but not to the end, there will sometimes be confusion, sometimes gathering together. If you call out, then after one grasp of the hand you can laugh again. Regret not. Going is without blame.
lines.explanation: Initial uncertainty in gathering resolves through genuine connection. Trust the process of coming together.

judgment.text: Pushing Upward has supreme success. One must see the great man. Fear not. Departure toward the south brings good fortune.
judgment.explanation: Progress comes through steady, upward effort. Like plants growing toward the sun, advance gradually but persistently with proper guidance.

image.text: Within the earth, wood grows: The image of Pushing Upward.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person, of devoted character, heaps up small things in order to achieve something high and great.

lines.meaning: Pushing upward that meets with confidence brings great good fortune.
lines.explanation: When initial efforts receive support, continued progress is assured. Trust and sincerity create favorable conditions.

judgment.text: Oppression. Success. Perseverance. The great man brings about good fortune. No blame. When one has something to say, it is not believed.
judgment.explanation: Even in times of hardship, maintain inner strength. Like water beneath a lake, depth of character sustains through difficult periods.

image.text: There is no water in the lake: The image of Exhaustion.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person stakes their life on following their will, maintaining purpose even when resources are scarce.

lines.meaning: One sits oppressed under a bare tree and strays into a gloomy valley. For three years one sees nothing.
lines.explanation: Initial difficulties may seem overwhelming. Patience and perseverance are needed when visibility is limited.

judgment.text: The Well. The town may be changed, but the well cannot be changed. It neither decreases nor increases. They come and go and draw from the well.
judgment.explanation: Fundamental principles remain constant despite external changes. Like a well serving many generations, true value endures and nourishes continuously.

image.text: Water over wood: The image of The Well.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person encourages the people at their work, and exhorts them to help one another, fostering community through shared resources.

lines.meaning: One does not drink the mud of the well. No animals come to an old well.
lines.explanation: Neglected resources lose their value. Regular maintenance and proper use keep vital sources pure and accessible.

judgment.text: Revolution. On your own day you are believed. Supreme success, furthering through perseverance. Remorse disappears.
judgment.explanation: Fundamental change requires proper timing and inner conviction. Like a snake shedding its skin, transformation must come at the right moment.

image.text: Fire in the lake: The image of Revolution.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person sets the calendar in order and makes the seasons clear, recognizing the right time for necessary changes.

lines.meaning: Wrapped in the hide of a yellow cow.
lines.explanation: Protection during transformation. Major changes require proper preparation and protection.

judgment.text: The Cauldron. Supreme good fortune. Success.
judgment.explanation: Like a sacred vessel transforming raw ingredients into nourishment, success comes through proper preparation and transformation of resources.

image.text: Fire over wood: The image of The Cauldron.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person consolidates their fate by making their position correct, establishing proper order through right relationships.

lines.meaning: A cauldron with legs upturned. Furthers removal of stagnating stuff. One takes a concubine for the sake of her son.
lines.explanation: Sometimes structures must be overturned to remove old patterns. Change serves a greater purpose.

judgment.text: Shock brings success. Shock comes—oh, oh! Laughing words—ha, ha! The shock terrifies for a hundred miles, and he does not let fall the sacrificial spoon and chalice.
judgment.explanation: Sudden movement creates opportunity for growth. Like thunder awakening new life in spring, shock can initiate positive change.

image.text: Thunder repeated: The image of Shock.
image.explanation: Thus in fear and trembling the superior person sets their life in order and examines themselves, maintaining alertness through awareness of danger.

lines.meaning: Shock comes—oh, oh! Then follow laughing words—ha, ha! Good fortune.
lines.explanation: Initial fear transforms into understanding. What first appears threatening may bring unexpected benefits.

judgment.text: Keeping Still. Keeping his back still so that he no longer feels his body. He goes into his courtyard and does not see his people. No blame.
judgment.explanation: True stillness brings clarity and power. Like a mountain's immovable presence, maintain inner peace while the world moves around you.

image.text: Mountains standing close together: The image of Keeping Still.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person does not permit their thoughts to go beyond their situation, finding strength in conscious limitation.

lines.meaning: Keeping his toes still. No blame. Continued perseverance furthers.
lines.explanation: Begin stillness from the foundation. Like a mountain's base, stability starts from the ground up.

judgment.text: Development. The maiden is given in marriage. Good fortune. Perseverance furthers.
judgment.explanation: Progress comes through gradual steps. Like wind shaping a mountain over time, lasting change requires patience and persistence.

image.text: On the mountain, a tree: The image of Development.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person abides in dignity and virtue, in order to improve the mores, allowing natural growth to take its course.

lines.meaning: The wild goose gradually draws near the shore. The young son is in danger. There is talk. No blame.
lines.explanation: Initial progress may face challenges. Like a bird approaching land, caution in new territory is natural.

judgment.text: The Marrying Maiden. Undertakings bring misfortune. Nothing that would further.
judgment.explanation: Some situations require acceptance of limitations. Like a younger daughter's marriage, recognize when circumstances dictate the proper order of events.

image.text: Thunder over the lake: The image of the Marrying Maiden.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person understands the transitory in the light of the eternity of the end, seeing both immediate conditions and ultimate purpose.

lines.meaning: The marrying maiden as a concubine. A lame man who is able to tread. Undertakings bring good fortune.
lines.explanation: Accept humble beginnings with dignity. Even limited progress in difficult circumstances can bring positive results.

judgment.text: Abundance has success. The king attains abundance. Be not sad. Be like the sun at midday.
judgment.explanation: A time of peak prosperity requires wisdom. Like the sun at its zenith, recognize that change will follow fullness.

image.text: Both thunder and lightning come: The image of Abundance.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person decides lawsuits and carries out punishments, bringing clarity to what was obscured.

lines.meaning: When a man meets his destined ruler, they can be together ten days, and it is not a mistake. Going meets with recognition.
lines.explanation: True alignment brings natural success. When timing and purpose meet, progress flows naturally.

judgment.text: The Wanderer. Success through smallness. Perseverance brings good fortune to the wanderer.
judgment.explanation: When in transition, maintain inner stability. Like a fire on a mountain, success comes through adaptability and careful resource management.

image.text: Fire on the mountain: The image of the Wanderer.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person is clear-minded and cautious in imposing penalties, and protracts no lawsuits, maintaining dignity while staying mobile.

lines.meaning: If the wanderer busies himself with trivial things, he draws down misfortune upon himself.
lines.explanation: Stay focused on what matters when in transition. Small distractions can lead to larger problems.

judgment.text: The Gentle. Success through what is small. It furthers one to have somewhere to go. It furthers one to see the great man.
judgment.explanation: Progress through gentle persistence. Like wind that gradually penetrates everywhere, influence through subtle but continuous action.

image.text: Winds following one upon the other: The image of the Gentle.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person spreads their commands abroad and carries out their undertakings, achieving influence through consistent action.

lines.meaning: In advancing and retreating, the perseverance of a warrior furthers.
lines.explanation: Flexibility with determination brings success. Know when to advance and when to yield.

judgment.text: The Joyous. Success. Perseverance is favorable.
judgment.explanation: True joy brings natural influence. Like a lake that refreshes all around it, genuine happiness attracts and nurtures others.

image.text: Lakes resting one on the other: The image of the Joyous.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person joins with their friends for discussion and practice, finding joy in continuous self-cultivation.

lines.meaning: Contented joyousness. Good fortune.
lines.explanation: Simple satisfaction brings true happiness. Contentment with what is appropriate leads to good fortune.

judgment.text: Dispersion. Success. The king approaches his temple. It furthers one to cross the great water. Perseverance furthers.
judgment.explanation: When rigid structures dissolve, new possibilities emerge. Like wind over water, movement brings fresh patterns and connections.

image.text: The wind drives over the water: The image of Dispersion.
image.explanation: Thus the kings of old sacrificed to the Lord and built temples, maintaining connection through times of change.

lines.meaning: He brings help with the strength of a horse. Good fortune.
lines.explanation: Swift action to assist others brings positive results. Energy properly directed helps overcome dissolution.

judgment.text: Limitation. Success. Galling limitation must not be persevered in.
judgment.explanation: Success through knowing proper limits. Like water contained by shores, boundaries create meaningful form and direction.

image.text: Water over lake: The image of Limitation.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person creates number and measure, and examines the nature of virtue and correct conduct, setting appropriate boundaries.

lines.meaning: The water flows smoothly. Good fortune.
lines.explanation: When one's actions are in harmony with the natural flow, success is assured.

judgment.text: Inner Truth. Pigs and fishes. Good fortune. It furthers one to cross the great water. Perseverance furthers.
judgment.explanation: Success through inner authenticity. Like wind moving over water, truth naturally influences and harmonizes.

image.text: Wind over lake: The image of Inner Truth.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person discusses criminal cases in order to delay executions, balancing justice with mercy.

lines.meaning: Being prepared brings good fortune. If there are secret designs, it is disquieting.
lines.explanation: Readiness with honesty brings success. Hidden agendas create inner tension and uncertainty.

judgment.text: Preponderance of the Small. Success. Perseverance furthers. Small things may be done; great things should not be done. The flying bird brings the message: It is not well to strive upward, it is well to remain below. Great good fortune.
judgment.explanation: Success through careful attention to small matters. Like a bird that knows when to fly high or stay low, wisdom lies in recognizing appropriate scale.

image.text: Thunder on the mountain: The image of Preponderance of the Small.
image.explanation: Thus in their conduct the superior person gives preponderance to reverence. In bereavement they give preponderance to grief. In their expenditures they give preponderance to thrift.

lines.meaning: The bird meets with misfortune through flying.
lines.explanation: Exceeding one's natural limits brings problems. Know when to maintain a lower profile.

judgment.text: After Completion. Success in small matters. Perseverance furthers. At the beginning good fortune, at the end disorder.
judgment.explanation: Even in completion, maintain vigilance. Like water over fire, balance must be actively maintained after achievement.

image.text: Water over fire: The image of After Completion.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person takes thought of misfortune and arms themselves against it in advance, maintaining awareness even in success.

lines.meaning: He breaks his wheels. He gets his tail in the water. No blame.
lines.explanation: Minor setbacks after completion are natural. Maintain perspective when small things go wrong.

judgment.text: Before Completion. Success. But if the little fox, after nearly completing the crossing, gets his tail in the water, there is nothing that would further.
judgment.explanation: Final stages require extra care. Like fire over water, maintain balance and attention until the very end.

image.text: Fire over water: The image of the condition before transition.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person is careful in the differentiation of things, so that each finds its place, ensuring proper order before completion.

lines.meaning: He gets his tail in the water. Humiliating.
lines.explanation: Carelessness near the end brings setbacks. Maintain focus until truly complete.

judgment.text: Possession in Great Measure. Supreme success.
judgment.explanation: A time of great abundance and potential. Success comes through proper management of resources and maintaining humility despite great fortune.

image.text: Fire in heaven above: the image of Possession in Great Measure.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person curbs evil and promotes good, and thereby obeys the benevolent will of heaven.

lines.meaning: No relationship with harm. It is not a mistake to remain correct.
lines.explanation: When great possession begins, maintain integrity to avoid complications.

lines.meaning: A big wagon for loading. There is somewhere to go. No mistake.
A prince makes an offering to the Son of Heaven. A petty person cannot do this.
He makes a difference between himself and his neighbor. No blame.
One whose truth is accessible, yet dignified, has good fortune.
He is blessed by heaven. Good fortune. Nothing that does not further.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Enthusiasm. It furthers one to install helpers and to set armies marching.
judgment.explanation: When enthusiasm aligns with proper leadership, great things can be accomplished. Success comes through channeling excitement into organized action.

image.text: Thunder comes forth from the Earth: The image of Enthusiasm.
image.explanation: Thus the ancient kings made music in order to honor merit, and offered it with splendor to the Supreme Deity, inviting their ancestors to be present.

lines.meaning: Enthusiasm that expresses itself brings misfortune.
lines.explanation: Excessive display of enthusiasm at the beginning leads to setbacks.

lines.meaning: Firm as a rock. Not a whole day. Perseverance brings good fortune.
Enthusiasm that looks upward creates remorse. Hesitation brings remorse.
The source of enthusiasm. He achieves great things. Doubt not. You gather friends around you as a hair clasp gathers the hair.
Persistently ill, and still does not die.
Deluded enthusiasm. But if after completion one changes, there is no blame.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: Following has supreme success. Perseverance furthers. No blame.
judgment.explanation: Following the right path at the right time brings success. Adapt to circumstances while maintaining integrity.

image.text: Thunder in the middle of the lake: The image of Following.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person at nightfall goes inside for rest and recuperation.

lines.meaning: The standard is changing. Perseverance brings good fortune. To go out of the door in company produces deeds.
lines.explanation: When standards change, adapt while maintaining principles.

lines.meaning: If one clings to the little boy, one loses the strong man.
If one clings to the strong man, one loses the little boy. Through following one finds what one seeks. It furthers one to remain persevering.
Following creates success. Perseverance brings misfortune. To go one's way with sincerity brings clarity. How could there be blame in this?
Sincere in the good. Good fortune.
He meets with firm allegiance and is still further bound. The king introduces him to the Western Mountain.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

name: Ku
description: Work on What Has Been Spoiled

judgment.text: Work on What Has Been Spoiled has supreme success. It furthers one to cross the great water. Before the starting point, three days. After the starting point, three days.
judgment.explanation: A time to correct past mistakes and restore order. Success comes through decisive action and careful timing.

image.text: The wind blows low on the mountain: The image of Decay.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person stirs up the people and strengthens their spirit.

lines.meaning: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. If there is a son, no blame rests upon the departed father. Danger. In the end good fortune.
Setting right what has been spoiled by the mother. One must not be too persevering.
Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. There will be little remorse. No great blame.
Tolerating what has been spoiled by the father. In continuing one sees humiliation.
Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. One meets with praise.
He does not serve kings and princes, sets himself higher goals.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: The Preponderance of the Great. The ridgepole sags to the breaking point. It furthers one to have somewhere to go. Success.
judgment.explanation: A time when extraordinary measures are needed. The situation has reached a critical point requiring decisive action.

image.text: The lake rises above the trees: The image of Preponderance of the Great.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person, when they stand alone, is unconcerned, and if they have to renounce the world, they remain undaunted.

lines.meaning: To spread white rushes underneath. No blame.
lines.explanation: Preparing carefully for a challenging situation.

lines.meaning: A dry poplar sprouts at the root. An older man takes a young wife. Everything furthers.
The ridgepole sags to the breaking point. Misfortune.
The ridgepole is braced. Good fortune. If there are ulterior motives, it is humiliating.
A withered poplar puts forth flowers. An older woman takes a husband. No blame, no praise.
One must go through the water. It goes over one's head. Misfortune. No blame.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: The Abysmal repeated. If you are sincere, you have success in your heart, and whatever you do succeeds.
judgment.explanation: In times of danger, maintain inner truth and keep moving forward. Success comes through perseverance and adaptability.

image.text: Water flows on uninterruptedly and reaches its goal: The image of the Abysmal repeated.
image.explanation: Thus the superior person maintains their virtue constant and carries on their teaching.

lines.meaning: Repetition of the Abysmal. In the abyss one falls into a pit. Misfortune.
The abyss is dangerous. One should strive to attain small things only.
Forward and backward, abyss on abyss. In danger like this, pause at first and wait, otherwise you will fall into a pit in the abyss. Do not act this way.
A jug of wine, a bowl of rice with it; Earthen vessels simply handed in through the window. There is certainly no blame in this.
The abyss is not filled to overflowing, it is filled only to the rim. No blame.
Bound with cords and ropes, shut in between thorn-hedged prison walls: For three years one does not find the way. Misfortune.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends

judgment.text: The Clinging. Perseverance furthers. It brings success. Care of the cow brings good fortune.
judgment.explanation: Clarity and insight lead to success. Nurture what is bright and true within yourself.

image.text: That which is bright rises twice: The image of Fire.
image.explanation: Thus the great person, by perpetuating this brightness, illumines the four quarters of the world.

lines.meaning: The footprints run crisscross. If one is seriously intent, no blame.
Yellow light. Supreme good fortune.
In the light of the setting sun, people either beat the pot and sing or sigh deeply. Misfortune.
Its coming is sudden; it flames up, dies down, is thrown away.
Tears in floods, sighing and lamenting. Good fortune.
The king uses him to march forth and chastise. Then it is best to kill the leaders and take captive the followers. No blame.

line_context.2: Embodies the inner world and reaction patterns
line_context.3: Shows response when thoughts meet manifestation
line_context.5: Often the highest expression of the hexagram's lesson
line_context.6: Often refers to how the energy becomes exhausted or ends
